Merge pull request #287 from NachoSoto/leaks

Fixed 2 leaks setting stackedTapHandler

Fixed 2 leaks setting stackedTapHandler

`ChartPointViewBarStacked` owns `stackedTapHandler`, so the handler must not reference its parent. This currently creates a cycle.
This is why it's important to reason about memory ownership instead of just blindly making `self` `weak` everywhere. There's nothing special about `self` that can lead to cycles, **anything** can lead to a cycle.

No need for a straight line to close() the path.

This behavior was causing a Path of straight lines to "close" its path. For example, a Path with points `(0, 2), (0, 7), (0, 5), (0, 1), (0, 4)` was finishing in `(0, 1)` instead of `(0, 4)`. For solid lines no one could see, but for dashed lines you could see that between the last 2 points, the dashed line was duplicated.

Merge pull request #240 from ArturoLee/HighlightCompletion

Optional completion handler for TouchHighlight fade animation

I am adding an Optional completion handler for TouchHighlight fade animation.

This was submitted previously, however there were issues when squashing. This was the previous description:
Having an optional completion handler for the TouchHighlight fade animation should come in handy. For example, if there are elements that change when a user starts panning, this will allow us to revert back to the original state. For example, you can have two fixed UILabels at the top of the view that correspond to a charts below it. They are initially set to the last X and Y values of the chart. As the user pans these values change. With this completion handler, the UILabels can switch back to the original values when user stops the pan (after the fade animation). This is just one example but I'm sure it can be useful. Let me know if you would like to change the naming convention.

Changed naming convention and other minor formatting/convention improvements.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'i-schuetz/master'

Merge pull request #237 from ArturoLee/chartAreasGradient

ChartPointsAreaLayer supports Gradient

ChartPointsAreaLayer now takes in an array of UIColors. If you pass one color in the array, the layer will just display that color. If you pass more than one color, the layer will display a gradient. In this case, the first color passed will be first color at the top of the gradient. The last color passed will be the last color at the bottom of gradient. To allow for full control of the visible gradient, the gradient will start at the highest pint of the visible line and end at the bottom of the visible chart.

Added a convenience initializer that accepts only one color
Added a guard statement for cases where an empty array of colors are passed.

Merge pull request #216 from NachoSoto/settings-struct

Changed ChartSettings and ChartSettingsZoomPan to struct

Changed ChartSettings and ChartSettingsZoomPan to struct

This ensures that they have value semantics. With it being a `class`, any modification is **shared** amongst all users of the instance.
That means that all changes to `ExampleDefaults.chartSettingsWithPanZoom`, for example, were being propagated to every observer. Now a local copy is made.

Set APPLICATION_EXTENSION_API_ONLY to YES

This allows using `SwiftCharts` from a framework. It avoids the following warning:
```
ld: warning: linking against a dylib which is not safe for use in application extensions: SwiftCharts.framework/SwiftCharts
```

Improve chart info bubble

Now layout updates correctly depending on space availability (e.g. bubble appears below the point and inverted when there's not enough space above). Initalizer now accepts a content view. Add convenience initializer to use a label as content view. Close on tap.

Implement global tap handling with chart delegate

It's still possible to do the handling at layer level. The handling using the chart delegate collects the points from all possible layers and it isn't type safe. Currently limited to ChartPointsLayer and subclasses, content layers that don't subclass ChartPointsLayer (i.e don't use ChartPoint to model items) need a separate implementation.

Ajust scale of chart content view on frame size change

Now when the content size is changed (i.e. label size changes due to initialisation/pan/zoom) the view is also scaled accordingly. Changing only the frame was causing offsets between chart points and axis values, since the position of the chart points remained unchaged.

Because of this change now also the min scale can't be 1 but has to be calculated dynamically. Also, since the content view now can be scaled before adding chart points the first time, it's not possible anymore to use directly screen coordinates to add views to the content view. Instead model coordinates should be used, which are mapped to screen coordinates by the layer, taking into account the current scale.

Implement dynamic update of axis labels.

Now it's possible to udpate axis labels by updating the label generator of the corresponding axis layer. When this update changes the size of the axis layer (orthogonal to the axis) the chart's components are resized / moved.
Implement generic label generator which delegates to closure
Update version
Implement conflict solving for axis labels

Implement axis values and labels generators

This is meant as alternative/possible future replacement for ChartAxisValue class. With generators it's not necessary anymore to create the axis values manually, instead it's possible to specify first and last model value and let the chart generate the values. This provides more flexibility and lets also the chart control the creation of axis values.

The generation of labels was also separated from the generation of axis values, since these are completely different things. The former creates strings that display the internal numbers. The later generates the numbers.

Also:
- Add convenience initialiser to ChartAxisModel to map the fixed axis values arrays to generators, this simplifies the creation of generators for fixed arrays and provides backwards compatibility for examples.
- Remove "hidden" field from label model model, this is not necessary since by simply not generating axis value / label, the label is not shown. Remove fields in axis layers and settings from dividers and guidelines layers to filter by axis value / label visibility.

Separate axis from layer with related UI elements

- Axis now has only data necessary to map between model values and screen locations
- Change layers to reference only axis instead of axis layer
- Modify layers that need axis layer UI data, like axis dividers layer, which needs current location of labels to reference additionally the axis layers. This may change in the future to recalculate the positions using model data and axis instead, to avoid this dependency, depending on performance/architecture requirements.
- Simplify bar layers interfaces, remove min spacing and direction settings. Now the direction is derived from the orientation of the bars (horizontal/vertical) and axis values. This improvement was a result of removing dependencies to axis layers.
- Rename some variables for better understability, add documentation.
